post_content:
"Do you still only choose Tide?

Tide is one of the most popular detergents, but itâ€™s not necessarily the best option for your health or the environment. The Environmental Working Group (EWG) has rated some Tide products with an â€œFâ€ due to their inclusion of toxic chemicals that can harm both humans and ecosystems.

Toxic Chemicals Found in Tide Detergents:
	1.	1,4-Dioxane: Classified as a probable human carcinogen, this chemical is a byproduct of the manufacturing process and is often found in Tide products. Itâ€™s persistent in the environment and can contaminate water supplies.
	2.	Synthetic Fragrances: These can contain hundreds of undisclosed chemicals, many of which are allergens, endocrine disruptors, or linked to respiratory issues.
	3.	Optical Brighteners: These are synthetic chemicals that make clothes appear whiter but can cause skin irritation and are not biodegradable.
	4.	Sodium Lauryl Sulfate (SLS): This surfactant can be harsh on the skin and has potential environmental toxicity.
	5.	Preservatives like Methylisothiazolinone: Known skin sensitizers and allergens, these can lead to dermatitis and other skin conditions.

Why Choose Safer Alternatives?
	â€¢	Health Benefits: Avoid exposure to potentially harmful chemicals that can trigger allergies, hormone disruptions, or more severe health concerns.
	â€¢	Eco-Friendly: Reduce water pollution and protect aquatic life from toxic, non-biodegradable substances.
	â€¢	Support Sustainable Brands: Many small, eco-conscious companies offer safer, plant-based, and effective cleaning solutions.

I Encourage you to download the Healthy Living app to see the ratings of their household products, and please know you donâ€™t have to compromise on safety. Message me for recommendations on cleaner and healthier detergent options."

"I want to share one thing that helped me successfully pivot multiple times in business. 

Vision.

Sometimes known in our world as â€œthe why that makes you cryâ€ 

And there was A LOT of crying in those first years of growing my biz. IYKYK

It all started with a picture of what could be, fueled by a passion that it would be.

I started that first business because I dreamt of a new life.  One with time freedom.

At that time, I had what most would consider to be a dream job consulting in leadership development, but I knew it was time for a change. 

A few years later, in the winter of 2019, I went away on a trip to the mountains with my family.

I had that same feeling, like a shift was coming. 

I wanted to go bigger. 

I wanted to build a business that was even more aligned with what I felt God was calling me to do. 

That December, I set what felt like an impossible goal of generating an additional $250k in the next year.

I took a risk and invested $18k in the program.

When I shared about my certification, people started reaching out to me to coach them.

It took on a life of its own. 

Six months later I was coaching a full practice and had made an additional 6-figures. 

By the end of the year, I hit my goal. 

God doesnâ€™t need a crowbar, but you have to have the willingness to dream big, create a compelling vision, and be courageous to take the next best step.

To start, visit earnings.arbonne.com if youâ€™d like to see whatâ€™s typical. 

This is an efforts based business. Like anything, it takes work to build something special. Weâ€™re here to show you whatâ€™s possible through the four levels of management in Arbonne.

Everyone starts as an Independent Consultant, it only costs $49 to get your website setup and start your Arbonne business.

To earn your first ~$500, work with your upline to produce your first ~2,500 in volume. 

The comp plan is built off of 2,500 building blocks.

The first of four levels of management is District Manager. At this level you are earning between ~$200-1,000/month. This is a range and this is totally efforts based and depends on the each individual business, as it does at every level hereafter.

The second level of management is Area Manager. At this level you are earning between $1,000-3,500/month based on your business. At this level your business also becomes WILLABLE. Something you can pass down generations.

The third level is Regional Vice President. At this level you can earn up to an $800/month success award towards any white Mercedes Benz of your choosing. The average monthly earnings are ~$4,000-9,000, depending on the size of your business.

The fourth and top level of management is National Vice President. At this level the average earnings are ~$22,000. Some earn more, some earn less, again, efforts based. This is truly life changing and youâ€™ve changed a lot of other peopleâ€™s lives on your way to this level.

"Hereâ€™s the real real about entrepreneurship.

It is hard. It is extraordinary, meaning you have to step out of ordinary. Ordinary thinking. Ordinary action. Ordinary work ethic. It requires winning in the dark. Facing rejection. Sweat equity. It requires expansion of oneself and of oneâ€™s comfort zone. You will ave naysayers. You will (hopefully) be obsessed. People wonâ€™t understand you. People will tell you to get back in line. People will ghost you. You may lose friends. Your circle will change. It will be uncomfortable. 

But on the other side of that, is beauty. Is growth. The human soul CRAVES growth. It CRAVES making a difference and having a purpose. It CRAVES freedom. 

Entrepreneurship can give you ll those things. But whoever told you it would be easy is lying. 

Easy? No. Fulfilling? Absolutely. 

If youâ€™ve had a tug on your heart to explore entrepreneurship, I encourage you to do it. But know it will require your full heart and your full commitment. Not necessarily full commitment of time, but a two feet in, dive in head first approach, otherwise you wonâ€™t make it.

"This industry isnâ€™t rocket scienceâ€¦

Is it easy? No. 

Is it simple? Yup! 

Is it for everyone? Noooope. 

Can it be for anyone? Yes.

Is this multi trillion dollar industry going anywhere?
Nope. (Anyone who is saying that is very out of touch + uneducated/likely trying to sell you their program to â€œbuild your own online brandâ€ and fearing you out of partnering with a legit NWM company)

If you are willing to become a student of network marketing and treat this like an actual BUSINESS (not a hobby) this model can transform your life. 

A lot if happening in our industry right now. Ensuring that you partner with a brand that has history is crucial. Who owes the company is also extremely important. DO YOUR RESEARCH. 

Selling a product that is CONSUMABLE on a 30 day cycle is also important. Ask yourself how often will my customers be using their products and how often will they need to reorder? If itâ€™s a product that only needs to be replaced every 6 months thatâ€™s not the smartest option. Make sure the company isnâ€™t just in one lane (i.e. just skincare, just makeup, just wine, just jewelry etc). 

You must diversify the ways you can help people and be in several multi billion dollar industries. What are the companyâ€™s morals? Are they transparent? Does most of their $ come from reps in the field or from ACTUAL customers? Are they making money or bleeding out slowly? What certifications do they have? Are they profit focused or do they focus on people and the planet over profit (a company that is a certified B corp is always extremely smart to align with). Are they focused on personal growth and development or is it more flashy ground floor flash get rich quick energy ğŸ˜¬âŒ? 

Partnering with leaders that are doing the do day in and day out who are always learning, growing and duplicating other leaders is essential to YOUR growth. Do NOT get caught up in the money or who has â€œthe best comp planâ€ ğŸ˜‚â€¦trust your gut and partner with the brand that feels aligned with you, your believes, your lifestyle, your mindset and can help the most people.

"Hey if you love sharing links to lots of different brands and arenâ€™t worried about money, all the power to you! Keep going!

But if you want to be compensated for what youâ€™re sharing, compensated for your impact, compensated more than one time when you introduce a customer to a brand, you should consider Network Marketing. Notice I said consider, not join. 

Letâ€™s be honest, affiliate marketing is nice, but Network Marketing can create FREEDOm in your life, if youâ€™re willing to work for it. 

Affiliate marketing is sharing a product, delivering people in your network to a brand and receiving typically 5-20% on the first time sale. Super smart for the brand, not the best for the affiliate if monetizing your influence is the goal. 

Weâ€™re all sharing things we love and use Whether itâ€™s our favorite restaurant, gym, health products, beauty products, movies and beyond. If you have an interest in creating an extra stream of revenue from your recommendations, Network Marketing is the smartest way to do that.

It allows you to create your own customer base, to which if you are recommending consumable products, you will continue to receive commissions on. In doing so, you build community and you build influence! Itâ€™s more than just sharing a link and bouncing from brand to brand. 

Some people just want to share things they love and arenâ€™t worried about making any money, and thatâ€™s great if youâ€™re financially set. But guess what? How many people in your life arenâ€™t financially set? 

You see Network Marketing allows you to empower other people to build a business and create financial flexibility int heir life, or beyond. It utilizes leverage, a tool used in business to help any business scale their reach and their impact. Income follows impact in this profession. 

Itâ€™s also a tremendous vehicle for personal growth and learning entrepreneurship and business, at a very low startup cost. 

If youâ€™re interested to learn more, shoot me a message saying â€œInterestedâ€ and Iâ€™d be happy to share more with you. The coolest part? Iâ€™m not successful just by recruiting you. My success is dependent on helping YOU be successful, whatever that looks like to you.

1ï¸âƒ£ Every single person here at some point made a DECISION they wanted a bigger life, they were done with their old life and this was a vehicle that could get them from where they were to where they wanted to go. Everyone had a VISION for a better life, and was willing to work for it.

Coachability is one of the biggest indicators to success in this industry. An insatiable appetite for learning and growth is a great indicator.

3ï¸âƒ£ Obsession. Everyone at one point, or multiple points in their business had an OBSESSION to reach the top. Obsession gets a bad rep sometimes because it is intense and makes normal people feel uncomfortable, but I believe it is a pre-requisite to success. There will be obsession seasons.

4ï¸âƒ£ Everyone had different backgrounds. You realize there is no particular personality trait, background, skills, age, or anything else that causes someone to be successful in this business. Itâ€™s not what youâ€™re equipped with, itâ€™s how you use what youâ€™re equipped with and what youâ€™re willing to do that makes the difference.

5ï¸âƒ£ Mission. Every one in Iceland is on a MISSION, and itâ€™s bigger than money. Money can be a part of the mission, but everyone wants to build something MASSIVE, make a huge impact, be the best, something bigger than them that is driving them.

post_content: "Happy Monday Everyone!  This past weekend I was reminiscing about a conversation I had with my daughter Hannah many years ago.  We were on a long flight and Hannah and I got out of seats to stretch our legs.  We walked to the back of the plane and looked out the window from the galley.  Hannah was about 6 years old at the time.  It was the middle of the night and when we looked out the window we could see the lights of small towns and villages below us.  Hannah asked me, \"Are those lights the stars that we see at night?\" \n\nEvery time I think about that moment I am still awestruck at the uncensored imaginations we have as children!  Space and time are limitless.  There was a time in our life when we believed that anything is possible.  When I think about this moment with my daughter I connect with the belief it's never too late to make our dreams come true."

label: mlm
post_content:
"I now have a Senior and Sophmore in HS.  I have less than one year before my oldest goes off to college ğŸ¥º. My other kid wants to do an exchange program that same year.  They are making me an empty nester ahead of schedule! 

As I look back on our memories back on Kindergarten, first science fairs, club sports, stock shows, academic awards, ceremonies, class parties, all those wonderful and amazing moments I realized how few of them I missed.  I think I can count on one hand the amount of times I had to miss one of my kids events.  And you know what?  Each and every one of them was when I worked outside of the home for someone else.  No joke. 

When I first became a WFH home with my own network marketing business well over 10 years ago my husband and I knew it was going to take time to build my salary up to what we were used to. We knew that it was not going to be easy.  But we also knew by taking that leap of faith and trusting that God Whisper, we were also about to gain so much more freedom of time with my kids. I served my PTO, had lunches with my kids, chaperoned field trips.  My kids never rode the bus. My kids never went to day care or afterschool care.  I was the one taking them to practices, parties, movies with friends or entertaining kids at our house. 

I got to do all those things and my kids remember that.  They might roll their eyes ğŸ™„ now and then, but they remember that I was there for it all. 

I had the time and freedom to do it. 
I did not have to ask for permission from my boss. I was my boss. 
I did not get my time docked or made to use my vacation time to go watch a game or tournament.  It was all my time.

I had the opportunity to give my kids the blessing of being there for all their little and big milestones and even though it makes me teary eyed - I am so, so thankful that I made that decision a decade ago to follow my heart and go all in. Thank God for those little whispers and nudges!

 The opportunities are out there, momma, I promise they are!  they are waiting for you to just ask about it. 
 #spanglishmomboss #mkgirl #myMKlife #pinkcadillac #diamondsandcadillacs #momofteens #GoalGetter2024 #femaleandlatinaownedbusiness"

post_content:
"not happy with your hair after trying everything !!!! I was in the same boat. 
I get you. 
 
Itâ€™s frustrating. 
Money and time waisted. 

I have the products that will help your scalp and hair. 

When using the right products, you will see change. 

Caring for your scalp is important because it is the foundation for healthy hair. A balanced scalp can help prevent issues like oiliness, dryness, discomfort ranging from temporary irritation and redness to tightness, itchiness, and flakiness, and even premature hair ageing.

Below are some key factors on how you should look after your scalp. 

Cleansing: Regularly washing your scalp helps remove dirt, excess oil, and product buildup. It helps prevent clogged hair follicles which can lead to issues like sensitive scalp/scalp discomfort. Use the appropriate sulfate-free MONAT Shampoo for your hair type to avoid stripping your scalp of its natural oils.

Conditioning: keeping your scalp hydrated and will help prevent dryness and flakiness. Focus the application of the conditioner and masque on the mid-lengths and ends of the hair to avoid making the scalp too oily.

Exfoliation: Scalp exfoliation can remove dead skin cells and product buildup that regular washing might miss. For oily scalp, choose Scalp Purifying Scrub. For dry scalp, choose Scalp Comfort Rebalancing Scalp Treatment. It promotes a healthy scalp environment and can reduce flakiness on the roots, lengths, and ends.

Hydration: If your scalp is excessively dry, it can lead to irritation and flakiness.
Use the appropriate hydrating and moisturising Shampoo, Conditioner, or Masque, along with regular use of Comfort Rebalancing Scalp Treatment and Rebalancing Serum. Include Damage Repair Bond Fortifying Hair Leave-In Cream and REJUVENIQE if your scalp is particularly dry. These products help promote a balanced scalp.

Massage: can stimulate blood flow to the hair follicles, 
It may promote hair growth."

post_content:
"G A P S

What are you reaching for in the gaps of your day?

Are you filling those gaps with more and more caffeine? Sugary snacks? Or not eating at all?

For optimum energy and wellness, the goal is to feed your body the nutrients that it needs over the course of the entire day... We are looking for consistency with balanced nutrients at the right time.

If we only rely on caffeine and sugar - the 3pm crash (and the 9pm cravings) will be inevitable.

This is a big focus in our 21 Day Challenge as part of the plan to get results!! 

Let's be proactive to what our bodies need 

#fuelyourbody #saynotothecaffienecrash #goodbyecaffiene #goodbyesugar #optimalwellness"

post_content:
"Around the age of 30, our bodies naturally begin to decrease the production of hyaluronic acid, which can lead to visible signs of aging and other health issues. Here are five top reasons why ingesting hyaluronic acid is beneficial for the body:

	1.	Improves Skin Hydration and Elasticity: Hyaluronic acid helps retain moisture in the skin, giving it a more plump, hydrated appearance. Ingesting it can enhance overall skin elasticity, reducing the appearance of wrinkles and fine lines.
	2.	Supports Joint Health: Hyaluronic acid is a key component of synovial fluid, which lubricates and cushions joints. Regular intake can help reduce joint pain and stiffness, particularly in people with conditions like osteoarthritis.
	3.	Boosts Wound Healing: It aids in tissue regeneration and wound healing by promoting the formation of new blood vessels and controlling inflammation. This can help with faster recovery from skin injuries.
	4.	Enhances Bone Strength: Some studies suggest that hyaluronic acid helps stimulate bone formation and maintain bone density, making it a potential aid in preventing bone-related issues like osteoporosis.
	5.	Aids in Digestive Health: Hyaluronic acid plays a role in maintaining the integrity of the gut lining, helping to reduce inflammation and support overall digestive health by keeping the tissues lubricated.

As hyaluronic acid levels decline with age, supplementing it can help combat these effects and promote overall health and vitality.

Comment Hyaluronic Acid to try it risk free."

post_content:
"Four Things Network Marketing(NM)/Multi Level Marketing (MLM) is Not

1. MLM is not a Get Rich Scheme: There is a time to plant, water & reap in NW. Hard (smart) work, consistency, Dedication & Focus is the key here.

2. MLM is not a Ponzi Scheme: A ponzi scheme is illegal. It's a doubling scheme where you are asked to bring some amount for a larger amount. They don't have products/services & so they eventually crash.

3. MLM is not a Pyramid Scheme: In a pyramid scheme, investors are well aware that the revenue they will generate comes from other investors.
They rob Peter to pay Paul.They get money from newer investors to pay older ones.
There is also no products/services. There is no source of creating legitimate revenue.

4. MLM is not a Woman's Business: It is not gender sensitive. It's a business for anybody who badly desire change for their finances & who also has a big dream.
The money make in MLM is not just for women
MLM is a level playing ground for everyone to make success on it. There are a lot of men in this industry.

Network marketing is a smart business opportunity in todayâ€™s ever-changing environment that offers you an opportunity to make money & develop yourself exponentially.

Network Marketing is a business model that allows product to move from the manufacturer directly to the end users with a team of people making this possible & the manufacturer share the profit with these sets of people. Here are 5 reasons why NM is significant:

1. An Opportunity To Earn Extra Cash
NM offers you an opportunity to generate income despite your current financial standing. With NW, you do not need to quit your day job as you can do network marketing as a side hustle.

Residual income is an earning that you continue to receive based on your earlier efforts. RI is based on sales of products and services.NM is important because it enables you to earn more and work less by building your passive income sources.

Network marketing companies are famous for creating revolutionary products that hit the market by storm. The huge demand for these products makes it easier to sell. Also, the products are designed specifically to generate repeat business.

If you have been placing your happiness in the future waiting for some event to take place. I would like to remind you that today is the best day of your life. Celebrate today! Use your best clothes, eat your best food, tell and show love to people you cherished today, not tomorrow! 

Stop worrying about that future event! Appreciate your spouse today! Forgive someone today! Start that business and take that decision today! Smile and laugh today! Today is the best day of your life.

label: general
post_content:
"THOUGHTS ON A CHANGING BODY || (through the pregnancy lens - but applies to other things too) 

To answer the question asked in my stories â€¦ it absolutely is hard.

Thereâ€™s no denying it. 

But I would get you to question (or maybe even challenge) what â€˜hardâ€™ personally means to you in this context. 

Iâ€™d also ask if the downside of the â€˜hardâ€™ outweighs the upsideâ€¦ 

only you can decide this (and I think we have to be mindful of not pressuring people into things in either direction - not our fortÃ© as a species). 

I can share some of my own perspective and experience thus far â€¦

Pregnancy has been â€˜hardâ€™ in the sense that is has forced me to:

- relinquish total control over my body - prompting me to ask myself if I ever really had much â€˜controlâ€™ over it to begin with or did pregnancy just force me to face a primal physical intuition that is beyond a lot of the previously perceived levels of â€˜controlâ€™?

- Accept change - an arguably important reality we all have to face at some point in our lives (if not all the time in small/large ways). 

- Detach - from whatever identity I had created for it in relation to sport and performance (however Iâ€™m kind of looking forward to re-igniting this post pregnancy). 

At the risk of sounding ridiculously earnest, I do want to say that I think life is a constant process of unfolding and pregnancy and child-rearing is just one direction of unfolding and evolving. 

Itâ€™s not the be all and end all of what life has to offer and equally I have found it to be incredible and interesting and wild - thus far (like a weird science project that I get to witness in my body - obviously itâ€™s much more than that too, I definitely donâ€™t want to minimise it either). 

I think your questions are so valid and important and often come with a layer of shame because of many societal pressures. So thanks for giving me the opportunity to think about it ğŸ©·

The answers can be harder to find without doing it but then once youâ€™re doing it, thereâ€™s no rewind button âª ğŸ˜… 

What is everyone elseâ€™s thoughts - pregnancy or not, our bodies change. Pregnancy just seems to do it in a short time frame (as does illness and injury and I would say grief too) ğŸ¤ŒğŸ½"

label: general
post_content:
"TIPS FOR TRAINING AT HOME | anyone that says you canâ€™t get good results from training at home is completely disregarding the fact that physical results donâ€™t come from the environment that you train in, but the efficacy of the stimulus (or stress) youâ€™re placing on your body, over time and whether youâ€™re recording from that stress. 

HOWEVER; while the environment doesnâ€™t solely determine the result, it absolutely can contribute to the motivation you have to engage with the health behaviour. 

One tricky part about training at home is the fact that the place you will often train, is ALSO the place that you relax, eat, make love, have arguments, play, study, work â€¦ all the things. These associations can contribute (or detract from) our desire to workout in that space. The gym offers a new space with the energy (and associations) of other people training around you which can be inspiring for some (or potentially intimidating for others). 

But going to the gym is not always possible so how can you transform your space and mental associations? Iâ€™ve shared some tips below:

1. Train in a spare room, rather than a common room (or outdoors).

2. Keep the equipment in your line of sight (it can be neat) but donâ€™t tuck it away completely or you wonâ€™t be visually prompted to workout. 

3. Plan each of your workouts and try to stick to them for a minimum of 4 weeks to allow for those adaptations. 

4. Keep a simple sets and reps diary next to you while you workout so you can measure progress that doesnâ€™t always revolve around the visual.

5. Remember that by training at home youâ€™re potentially also influencing your loved ones to do the same. Think of the perspective around exercise babies and children will have if they see you committing to training each day or week (sure, they might try to derail it sometimes, but humans learn much more through observation so itâ€™s a beautiful and worthy cause that exists outside of yourself). 

What have I missed? What are some tips my Vertue Crew can share to help you feel more motivated to train at home when the gym just isnâ€™t possible?"

label: general
post_content:
"FLEXIBLE HIPS IN FOUR EASY MOVES

This is a more beginner friendly sequence than my last one - BUT let me tell you, I have worked with dancers, gymnasts and yogis who neglect their internal rotation work. So donâ€™t be thinking that this is too beginner for you. I guarantee that internal rotation stretch will send you into a deep existential crisis that will eventually lead to the emancipation of a more enlightened Self. 

Stretch 1: Internal Rotation (the intensity of this will depend on your height relative to your couch. If itâ€™s not high enough, you may need to add cushions under your foot to increase the internal rotation). WATCH OUT FOR A HIKING HIP - keep your hips square. 

Stretch 2: This is like a standing pigeon or standing 90 stretch and will really stretch the glutes well. If itâ€™s not intense enough lean forward with a straight spine. 

Stretch 3: Again look out for that hiking hip. If your hamstrings and inner thighs are stiff youâ€™ll find your butt (on the side your stretching) wants to stick up and out. Try to drop it. 

Stretch 4: Keep the knee close to the wall, tuck your tailbone and use a chair like @jwong.ok is doing to provide extra support for your upper body. 

Hold each stretch for 1-2 minutes - add active isometric contractions at the end of each stretch for faster stretch gains (not sure what those are? DM me and check out my stretch programmes). 

Send this to your favourite stretch partner and get it into your daily routine. 

Not sorry about the intense morning face I have here - I really needed you to know that this is what I do when I first wake up. It takes no time at all and if you work as a desk, itâ€™s the best for those stiff hips. 

#vertuemethod #vertuemethodstretch ğŸ©·ğŸ˜®â€ğŸ’¨"

label: general
post_content:
"BEFORE & AFTERS | Can we talk about them? 

I made choice a long time ago to NOT use B&Aâ€™s to advertise my programmes because I am passionate about people viewing physical activity as more than just what it might do for your bodyâ€™s appearance. It felt like the narrative was skewed in favour of using them as the sole method for promoting health and fitness.

BUT â€¦ now it feels as though the pendulum has swung and we are inadvertently shaming people for wanting to express the proudness they feel for the physical representation of their hard work over time. 

Something about this narrative against the B&A isnâ€™t sitting well with me anymore and I would love to unpack a few reasons why:

Reason 1: I feel like thereâ€™s a weird hypocrisy going on where we arenâ€™t holding the same moral expectations to plastic surgeons and aestheticians for sharing B & Aâ€™s on the changes they are making to their clients faces or bodies in the way that personal trainers and other health and fitness businesses are. Iâ€™m not saying that we should be but I canâ€™t really wrap my head around it. 

Reason 2: Ultimately when we go after the health professionals for sharing B&As we are also unintentionally going after the people who are in those pictures. We are covertly suggesting that these people are a part of the problem because they are â€˜proudâ€™ of their transformation. 

Why is this a potential issue?

I think it causes many people to internalise their desire to make changes to their body (whether through surgery or fitness). This makes people either feel like they canâ€™t speak out loud about it, or should feel ashamed for wanting it. 

I guess what I want to know is this - is there a way for us to celebrate the changes people make to their appearance without a.) Feeling as though itâ€™s an attack on our own experience or existence? And b.) accepting responsibility for the fact that we wonâ€™t ever know all details from two single, side by side pictures. 

(my thoughts arenâ€™t really fully formed and I know that my slim, able-bodied perspective will have some significant blind spots - so Iâ€™d love your input)."

"QUICK 3rd Trimester CIRCUIT / Save to Rave / Workout Written below

I think this would have been hard even without the human 3d printing depending on the load you choose to perform these. 

Iâ€™ve moved back to interval training like this because itâ€™s quick and I can slot it into my day between uni and work and then still take a walk later (or earlier). Iâ€™m trying to move more frequently because Iâ€™ve reduced intensity of training and Iâ€™m finding that long periods of sitting feel really uncomfortable for my hips and back.

This has very much been modified to accommodate for my body. Some of these exercises may be contraindicated for your pregnancy so itâ€™s really important to know your own capacity. I share these for inspiration not necessarily for copying - you may need to sub out exercises accordingly.

WORKOUT:

5 minute warm up - starting at 60rpms moving up to 90rpm for the last minute RPE:  10-11 (keep it chill) 

B-stance RDL x 12 each leg
Kneeling SA OH press x 12 each arm
Step Back Lunge x 15 each leg
Bike 1m @90rpm RPE: 11-13
X 4 rounds 

RPE = Rate of perceived exertion from the Borg Scale. Interestingly itâ€™s not always the best (most valid or reliable) measure BUT itâ€™s widely used and has demonstrated good validity in pregnant people. 
Cheeky little open access paper (love those) if you want to read more â€¦ PMCID: PMC7523906PMID: 33042367"

"How do you actually grow muscle with training? 

Well thereâ€™s actually a few mechanisms for hypertrophy (muscle growth) and your best bet is to try to hit all of them (so that you develop strength too). 

I write about this stuff in my newsletter so hit the link on my page to sign up (I donâ€™t spam you, itâ€™s always useful and applicable information - like my podcast @vertue_podcast ). 

Hereâ€™s the thing; thereâ€™s a few things this creator has left out and that includes the fact that effort makes a difference - so you actually CAN see â€˜b00tie gainsâ€™ if you are lifting heavy enough to create a stimulus that will stimulate growth. 

However the glutes do respond really well to all rep ranges (loads), so if youâ€™ve hit a plateau with your training it might be worthwhile trying a lower rep range with a heavier weight. 

Now ideally you would do this in a structured and periodised manner - if youâ€™re confused, like I said â€¦ I explain all of this and more in my newsletter which is also free.

label: general
post_content:
"Still sleeping with your ex? Here are five cognitive biases that are harming your health â€¦. | NEW PODCAST ALERT

Cognitive Biases are systematic patterns of deviation from norm or rationality in judgment, where inferences about other people and situations may be drawn in a somewhat illogical fashion - and because theyâ€™re so quick we donâ€™t even question whether theyâ€™re logic, we just behave as if they are. 

These biases are often a result of the brain's attempt to simplify information processing.

There are obviously LOADS of these badboys but the five I discuss are:

1. Anchoring Bias: This is the tendency to rely heavily on the first piece of information offered (the "anchor") when making decisions. â€˜Carbs make you fatâ€™ or â€˜Weights make you bulkyâ€™ - if these were some of the first things you heard when embarking on a fitness journey - they are hard to shake. 

2. The Halo effect: Crudely put, this bias is when we trust hot people more than they perhaps deserve credit for â€¦ That was a very crude explaination and doesnâ€™t quite hit it but I unpack a great study on this effect and how it impacted trustworthiness during the rona pano.*

3. Action Bias: This is the tendency to favor action over inaction - feel the need to constantly change things up with your programme? Yeah this little bias might be the culprit and itâ€™s getting in the way of results.

4. The empathy gap: I loved this one the most because I make huge huge errors here. This is the bias that will have you thinking itâ€™s perfectly fine to go over to your exes for a â€˜catch-upâ€™ convincing yourself that you definitely wonâ€™t hook up.

5. Fundamental attribution error: This is the tendency to place an undue emphasis on internal characteristics to explain someone else's behaviour in a given situation, rather than considering external factors. This one can really wreak havoc on our self-esteem and self-efficacy - how? Youâ€™ll have to listen. 

Itâ€™s a 30 minute episode and it will not disappoint. As always the goal with the @vertue_podcast is to leave you with some food for thought that can be PRACTICALLY applied to your health and wellness journey TODAY."

label: general
post_content:
"Pregnancy Weight Gain - some THOUGHTS ğŸ’­ AND SOME FACTS âœ…ğŸ‘‡ğŸ¾

Unfortunately in many societies weight gain is associated with a bunch of stigma. Some of it comes from a broader societal influence and some of it originates within our own households, upbringings and experiences which ultimately interact with other psychological factors that eventually shape the views we have of the weight gain we experience in ourselves.

On the other hand, PREGNANCY weight gain tends to sit in this sort of grey area of â€˜stigmaâ€™ where itâ€™s kind of expected and yet when youâ€™re going through it you still feel / notice the effects of this internalised stigma. 

However, this idea that we should be aiming for a skinny pregnancy (yeah I saw it on tiktok) is deeply misguided and dangerous. 

Firstly, gaining weight when youâ€™re pregnananÃ© is really important for the babyâ€™s growth and development, as well as for the motherâ€™s health during and after pregnancy.

Gaining weight during pregnancy, is not just the baby growing. Thereâ€™s the weight of the baby itself, the amniotic fluid that surrounds the baby in the womb, and the placenta. Together, these account for about 38% of the weight gain.

The rest of the weight is because your body is changing â€“ your blood volume increases (by up to 50-60% - this is wild. Vampires would love us), thereâ€™s more fluid in your body, your uterus and breasts get larger, and we store more fat. 

Most of the extra fat is stored under the skin (subcutaneous) and typically goes to places like the hips, back, and upper thighs (I have a whole bunch on the back of my arms now too). This fat storage is unique to pregnancy and starts to build up mostly in the first 30 weeks, under the influence of the hormone progesterone.*

All of this contributes to the protection of your own body and the health of your baby.

Annoyingly, I know that the effects of individual body image and weight stigma can be more powerful than a statement like; â€œitâ€™s good for the health of your body and your baby.â€ This, coupled with the feeling of surrendering your body to a primal and natural process, completely out of your control can be incredibly disorientating. 

Continued in comments ğŸ‘‡ğŸ¾"

"LONG AND LEAN ğŸŒ How to get that look | The Truth

Because long and lean is often attributed to a â€˜dancers bodyâ€™, we make a sort of attribution error, assuming that their body looks a certain way because of ballet or Pilates, while ignoring their genetics, bone structure, and maybe that they spend seven hours a day dancing and are encouraged to diet to dangerous levels. 

The BAD NEWS:
The long and lean aesthetic is essentially the combination of having a certain bone structure (or length) and being lean. So because we canâ€™t change our bone length (without invasive and awful, awful surgical procedures) all weâ€™re reallly taking about here is getting lean. In reality you can do that by reducing calories - but is that really what youâ€™re wanting? 

THE GOOD NEWS 
You can develop an athletic (with definition) body while remaining lean (or getting lean). AND you can do it from home or the gym. It takes consistency, enough protein (and carbs) and progressive overload (things getting harder over time). 
If youâ€™re wanting specific body parts to become more specific, youâ€™ll want to choose exercises that maximise muscle growth in those areas. 

Wait - GROWTH? But growth is a scary word for me when I actually want to go down a size: 

Never fear - muscle growth IS so beneficial for a number of reasons (that I will cover in future posts and podcasts). For know, from a purely aesthetic perspective, if you want definition - you NEED muscle. 

So letâ€™s get building. Save this workout and start integrating these exercises into your regime (keeping track of your progress - even if itâ€™s just in your notes app). 

Sets: 
1 x warm up set 
3 x working sets 

Reps:
10 - 15

RIR: 
Warm up: 3
Working sets: 2-1

"As always â€¦ ğŸ˜›ğŸ˜›ğŸ˜›

What works in one postpartum recovery or pregnancy will not necessarily work for another. However the fear mongering has to stop.

After a distinctive phase of controlled core work that involved mostly rehab exercises, Iâ€™ve now progressed to a phase of flexed (spine) holds. I will do this for the next 12 weeks to slowly build strength back in my abdominal region which still feels pretty weak (but not at all sore). My Diastasis Recti is negligible and I really put that down to making sure I did not perform exercises that created any â€˜domingâ€™ in my abs (exacerbating that separation of the linea alba) during pregnancy. 

*I have to be honest though, I had gymnastic coaches that used to yell at us if we â€˜domedâ€™ during our ab work so I think I have been lucky my whole life - as this had been a standard for me way way prior to gymnastics and I have been talking about it on my page for years* 

Ab Routine:

Modified Hollow Body - 4 sets, 30 second hold.
I am performing a contralateral version where I have one arm extended and one leg extended (opposite sides). Each holding for a total of 30 seconds or until I see doming. 

Crunch Hold - 4 sets, 30 second hold
Static crunch hold, chin tucked, spine imprinted (controversial) and of course no doming. 

Plank - 4 sets, 30 second hold
Same standard as above. Spine is not in neutral and I squeeze my glutes. 

Kneeling Side Plank - 2 sets, 60 second hold each side

I rest for one minute in between sets and longer if I see a drop in my technique. 

I will share more in some upcoming YT and Podcasts ( @vertue_podcast ) because as always nuance is a little tricky here."

post_content:
"TRAINING WITH AN INJURY | My survival tips (psychological as well as physical) | The last slide is a breakdown of my routine in that first week post c-section â¤ï¸ 

Fear is the dominant emotion for me after an injury. 
Fear of re-injuring
Fear of the pain
Fear of losing what I had worked for
Fear of not knowing whether Iâ€™m pushing too hard or not hard enough. 

But frustratingly, being in a fear state can actually increase your pain perception and that then obviously makes you more scared - it becomes a vicious cycle. 

So I wanted to share the practices I undertake when recovering from an injury that have really helped me recover both from major abdominal surgery (a c-section) and all the broken bones I accumulated in Jiu-jitsu (weâ€™re up to 4 broken bones from jj now):

1. Check-in prior to training; this takes a lot of honesty which can be difficult because weâ€™re the most amazing liars when it comes to self-denial (or I am anyway). Prior to every training session I will take a moment to sit with myself for five minutes (I actually set a timer) and take a moment to feel into my body. Am I ready for this session? Is the rest of my body feeling up to this session? Is this session motivated by love or fear? (If itâ€™s fear, I try to shift my perspective before engaging with the workout). 
2. Acknowledge that injury is an opportunity to learn more about my body - every time I am injured I learn so much more about the inner workings of the human body and it helps me in my work and in my quality of life. 
3. Visualisation Meditation: I know it sounds kooky but the research, while of course not conclusive, is at least promising. Iâ€™ve been using a lot of my designated meditation time to perform visualisations of my body, moving and performing in the way that I want it to. According to the research on this, using a combination of mental imagery and physical practice is more efficient than, or at least comparable to, physical execution with respect to strength performance. If you donâ€™t believe me, check the systematic review on the effects of Mental Imagery on Muscular Strength in Healthy and Patient Participants (itâ€™s open access baby). 

Continued in the comments ğŸ‘‡ğŸ½"

post_content:
"C-Section Core Recovery (weeks 2-6) | Iâ€™m now 21 weeks PP, feeling stronger each day. 

However I was so cautious coming into training because I KNEW (from previous attempts at rehab exercises) that I would try to rush my body into exercises that it just didnâ€™t have the capacity to handle. 

Instead, I took the time to consult with both Pelvic Floor Physioâ€™s and OBGYN Surgeons to understand what was happening both generally and with my own body. 

These exercises were where we started to slowly build things back. 

After six weeks we assessed and I progressed to some harder exercises (which I will also share in another post). These involved stronger flexion â€˜holdsâ€™. Itâ€™s recommended that these be performed for a minimum of 12 weeks to six months before moving onto dynamic exercises. Iâ€™ve since found that I am able to move to more dynamic exercises but I know itâ€™s because I both committed to these isometric holds AND I could do advanced dynamic exercises pre-pregnancy.

While I want to say â€˜itâ€™s so important to listen to your bodyâ€™ (and it is) the hard part about a c-section is that you canâ€™t actually feel your body. So I found that statement really frustrating. Instead my recommendation is to err on the side of caution, pay attention to form and be consistent even if it doesnâ€™t feel like youâ€™re doing much. 

My reps and sets progressed as follows: Weeks 1-2: 10 reps, 2 sets / Weeks 3-4: 10 reps 3 sets / Weeks 5-6: 10 reps 4 sets."

label: general
post_content:
"The short answer is yes you can still exercise and thereâ€™s an argument that it will actually BENEFIT you (rather than deplete).

This is for anyone who is struggling with consistently bad sleep. 

This is for the parents, the people who struggle with insomnia. The shift workers. But itâ€™s also for anyone who is having some short term sleep issues. 

It gets to the point where youâ€™re so tired, the thought of exercise feels a bit ridiculous (even harmful), however you also know that sleep isnâ€™t likely to get better soon and you canâ€™t just go on avoiding exercise because that also makes you feel worse. 

So what can you do?

Well, a recent meta-analysis explored whether moderate physical exercise could mitigate these negative effects in rodents. The results indicate that exercise can indeed prevent cognitive impairments and anxiety-like behaviours caused by sleep deprivation, potentially through various molecular pathways, suggesting that exercise could serve as a preventative or therapeutic measure against the repercussions of sleep loss.

Iâ€™m going to unpack this in full on my podcast but â€¦ in the meantime, the answer is mostly like to be: Exercise anyway. 

The type and intensity might have to be slightly reduced until you have a good night sleep but it doesnâ€™t have to stop and in fact you might actually reduce the other negative effects of sleep by pushing yourself to do it anyway.

Hereâ€™s what I do:
1. Reduce the length of my workouts - training for 20-30 minutes.
2. Take a 60 minute walk with Ayana daily
3. Train upper body (as it usually isnâ€™t as demanding on my nervous system as a leg session).

What do you do? Iâ€™d love to hear from the sleep deprivation crew in the comments ğŸ©·

More details on the study:
The exercise in the study was mostly treadmill based (there was one resistant based training protocol but you canâ€™t really get rats doing CrossFit or power lifting yet - but Iâ€™m sure someone is working on it). However what they found was that 4 weeks of consistent daily treadmill work (60 minutes daily) produced these cognitive and anti-inflammitory benefits."

label: general
post_content:
"TRAINING WITH A COLD | Can you? Should you? Especially when youâ€™re kind of recovered but still have those really attractive phlegm-y symptomsâ€¦ well, the research may surprise you (or be completely unsurprising and totally match your bias - in which case, yay for you - I love when that happens) ğŸ‘‡ğŸ½ğŸ‘‡ğŸ½ğŸ‘‡ğŸ½

Based on a review by Martin, Pence, and Woods (2010) research has shown that moderate exercise (50-70% HR) can reduce inflammation and boost the immune system against respiratory infections like colds and flu. The findings suggest that moderate exercise increases stress hormones, helping control inflammation, potentially enhancing the bodyâ€™s antiviral defenses. This balanced immune response prevents excessive reactions that could cause harm. 

However, perhaps more interestingly (and annoyingly) prolonged intense exercise might tip the balance too much, making it easier for viruses to cause more severe illness. 

The â€œJ-shapedâ€ model on the second slide illustrates that while sedentary people have a normal risk of infections, those engaging in low-to-moderate exercise have a reduced risk. Conversely, high-intensity exercise increases the risk of respiratory infections. Have any of you found this is the case for you too (especially when you undertake a new programme that has a lot higher intensity work?)

What I took away from this research was that when youâ€™re at that sort of end point of a respiratory virus, stay active, but keep it moderate intensity. 

Donâ€™t rush back into your usual intense training as it might actually make things much, much worse. Also if you DO go back to that HIIT work (particularly prolonged) make sure youâ€™re doing the necessary protocols to recover (reducing that allostatic load).

Send this to that person who always seems to get sick when they start exercising again - maybe the intensity is too high, too soon?"

label: general
post_content:
"If you feel disheartened, just remember that the body is trying to make you better at whatever youâ€™re consistently doing. Sometimes that â€˜consistencyâ€™ is hard to trust, particularly if it isnâ€™t as â€˜intenseâ€™ as you once had the capacity to handle. 

But feeling disheartened can often lead us to things that definitely ARENâ€™T in the direction of recovery. These are often:
~ training too hard, too quickly
~ changing your plan too often (because we donâ€™t â€˜trustâ€™ it or a bored by it)
~ completely giving up (only to be met with the pain or restriction of your injury again). 

THIS IS WHERE SPORTS PSYCHOLOGY CAN HELP âš½ï¸ ğŸ§  there are many techniques within this domain but something that can be really helpful is cognitive restructuring. Now it comes from cognitive behavioural therapy but when used in a training context it can be a powerful tool for anyone dealing with injuries by helping you to shift your mindset from negative to positive. When youâ€™re injured, itâ€™s common to have thoughts like â€œIâ€™ll never recoverâ€ or â€œThis setback ruins everything.â€ Cognitive restructuring involves identifying these negative thoughts, challenging their accuracy, and replacing them with positive, realistic ones, such as â€œI can use this time to come back strongerâ€ or â€œRecovery is part of my journey.â€ 

Now itâ€™s not about cultivating toxic positivity - there are actually mental exercises you have to do (sort of like homework) to help you process and challenge these automatic (often negative) thoughts. 

I talk about this stuff a lot more on the @vertue_podcast in several different episodes. â¤ï¸
Iâ€™ll unpack more shortly ğŸ™ğŸ½ğŸ§ 

Drop your favourite mindset tools for recovering from setbacks ğŸ‘‡ğŸ½ğŸ‘‡ğŸ½ğŸ‘‡ğŸ½"

"Want a deeper squat but your ankles and hips wonâ€™t let you? Try this sequence of passive and active stretches 3 x a week for 6 weeks and youâ€™ll see improvements in that depth. 

Foam Rolling: although people love to poop on it, it can be really helpful to improve your stretch tolerance so you can go deeper into some of the other stretches weâ€™ll do. So donâ€™t knock it until youâ€™ve tried it in conjunction with these other stretches.

Passive ankle stretch: the great part about this one is that it also opens up the hips too. I have loads more ankle work in my flexibility programme. 

Frog stretch: everyone does this with the knees in alignment with the hips and this is a GREAT way to do it, but for squat depth we also want to emulate the shape of the squat AND make sure our back isnâ€™t rounding. 

Active squat: I think this one is self explanatory but if youâ€™re doing this one with your back rounded, youâ€™re not changing the position to facilitate a deeper squat. So use your elbows and donâ€™t go as deep if itâ€™s too tricky. 

Hold passive for 2 minutes or longer and perform the active work for no less than 20 reps (you can break these up into two sets). 

This isnâ€™t a â€˜pre-squatâ€™ routine, this is a routine to help your squats become deeper over time. ğŸ‹ğŸ½â€â™€ï¸

Save it and let me know how long you can eventually go ğŸ˜ Iâ€™m serious about the eye contact."

post_content:
"Ah what an emotional roller coaster the first 4 episodes have been! Thank you for all your support and comments and trust me, I understand both the good and bad â¤ï¸

It makes me sad that all the hours of dating Oskar in the pods as well in Cyprus has been cut out and heavily edited into a few few minutes of drama and akwardness and nothing more. Although I did indeed feel insecurity and fears (I mean, a marriage was on the line after all) I also had this strong gut feeling and trust that this was worth pursuing. We shared so many beautiful dates and talks hopeful about the future that you never got to see.

So just keep in mind, that the episodes youâ€™ve seen donâ€™t fully represent what our relationship was at that point, they are also in the very beginning of our journey, and thereâ€™s soooo much more to come. 

Weâ€™ll see you in the next 4 episodes this Friday!"

post_content:
"Glad I donâ€™t KNEEâ€™D those crutches anymore. They finally got me Christopher WALKen. Okay, dad jokes asideâ€¦
â€œBrace yourselfâ€ this is a long video and even longer caption. Last one ğŸ˜‚ğŸ«£

A lot of people in the comments have been asking â€œwhat happenedâ€, â€œhow are you doingâ€, â€œwhen will you be able to walkâ€. Etc. I like to keep things light and funny on here. But when I first got hurt, Lindsey Vonn posted about her knee surgery and it made me feel less alone. So I decided to share my experience in the hopes that it helps others in the same situation find comfort or at least know what to expect on the long road to recovering from a torn ACL, meniscus and in my case, also a tibial plateau fracture. 
It sucks. Iâ€™m not gonna sugar coat it. Sometimes the universe sends you a message that you donâ€™t really want to hear. In my case, the universe wasnâ€™t not askingâ€¦ it was telling me to slow down. As someone who identifies as a â€œhighly independent personâ€ who is a â€œbusy bodyâ€ that canâ€™t sit still, this has been an especially challenging time. Being immobile and having to be so dependent on others hasnâ€™t been easy. Asking for help is even harder, but I havenâ€™t had a choice. My community of friends, have really showed up for me in such a beautiful way. You know who you are. Thank you from the bottom of my heart. Because the truth is, everyone talks about the physical pain (and yes it has been extremely painful) of an injury but seldomly do they talk about the mental toll it takes. I had a lot of anxiety when I first got injured, because I didnâ€™t want to â€œbotherâ€ people or be an inconvenience. Iâ€™ve been really struggling with the loud voices in my head that keep saying â€œyouâ€™re a burdenâ€. I have some work to do still in therapy. Iâ€™m learning that community is important. We canâ€™t do everything all alone. My body has been so stagnant for so long, finally getting to move, and slowly start putting pressure on my leg has changed my mental state so much. Iâ€™m trying to be kinder to myself, to remind myself that this is temporary and it will get better. Since I started walking & traveling a bit Iâ€™ve been feeling much more positive, I can finally see the light at the end of the tunnelğŸ’«"

post_content:
"My Fatherâ€™s Baseball
â–ªï¸
I have some really down days, too. And this is one of them. 
Itâ€™s been six years since the day my father passed away, on October 6th. Hard to believe. But itâ€™s only been a couple of years since I started to talk about losing him, and opening up to my family and friends. 
I went through a really dark time after he died. I didnâ€™t think I was ever going to be okay again, and I lived in silence and hiding for a few years. But a remarkable thing happened when I finally did shareâ€”I was met with warmth and support and encouragement to stay open, and to find the help I needed. And now I know that I am not alone.
I miss my dad every day. That incredible man made me who I am, and, no matter what, I will have his memory with me. Those we love may leave, but what we lived with them can never go. Love you, Papa.
â™¥ï¸
Stay open. Share. Talk about what you are feeling.

post_content:
"Well look at that: itâ€™s Mental Health Month again! And what interesting timing for me, personallyâ€¦ letâ€™s talk about it.

This year has tested me in so many ways, providing some of the best moments of my life while also finding new ways to kick me when I was down. It was infuritatingâ€”I had so much to be grateful for and so many aspects of my life were lining up just as Iâ€™d always dreamedâ€¦ but all the same I felt this weight in my chest that kept pulling me down and not letting me up. But thatâ€™s how depression is. Itâ€™s not really concerned with what you consider to be convenient or rational, or ideal. And, this year, I really felt like quitting at times, and giving up. And it was only when I allowed myself to be honest about my struggle that I was finally able to begin the healing process. It was, once again, a turning point for me in my life when I was able to start a sentence about my own wellbeing with â€œI donâ€™t mindâ€¦â€. Admitting you need help is the only way to find it. Iâ€™m still a work in progress, and not every day is a good day. But Iâ€™m working on it. 
Take care of yourself. Be there for your friends and family, and show yourself the same compassion you would show your best friend. And while youâ€™re at it, use this occasional toxic and negative platform for something positive and good. Because you CAN make a difference, and every time you chose to, you DO.

I also want to bring in tons of money for @mentalhealthamerica this month so they can keep doing all the amazing work theyâ€™re doing, so buy this shirt and every other new item from the May collection at idontmind.com and make all of our hearts happy. ğŸ’ªğŸ‚ğŸ’ƒ These folks make @idontmind possible!

Sending love and kindness to everyone, even the trolliest of trolls out there. Happy Mental Health Month, friends. #IDONTMIND #MentalHealthMonth â—¼ï¸â™¥ï¸"

label: general
post_content:
"The personal is political. Period.

We donâ€™t need for individual women to have fairer relationships with individual men. We need a collective shift, an overhaul, a seismic shift. We need to dismantle, to connect the dots and crumble the hierarchies that oppress. Not just in our home, but broadly.

Patriarchy, white supremacy, capitalism and imperialism work together. They are tied and tangled.

We cannot limit our change to shifts behind closed doors. We have to reflect on how the undervaluing of care contributes to the mass exploitation of workers. How does the overvaluing of profit and culture of individualism contribute to the death and displacement in the Democratic Republic of Congo? How does the devaluation of life-making labor fuel war? How does it create and encourage rampant antisemitism or the genocide of Palestinians? It is all tied together.

Domestic labor is political.

Note: for resources regarding the importance of battling antisemitism in your activism, please see my disclaimer highlight. Self reflection on the subtle and overt dehumanizing of all people must be an ongoing practice and while I am cautious, I am also imperfect. I hope that my advocacy will always lead to the reduction of harm for all and for the liberation of all and when it comes to the urgent call for the end to genocide of Palestinians, it also must include the intentional consideration of the protection of Jewish people and a rejection of antisemitism."

post_content:
"We are each individually responsible for an ongoing commitment to dismantling sexism, racism and all other forms of oppression every single day. 

Despite how it might feel, dominating other peoples time by opting out of domestic labor at home is not actual power or strength. Self-reliance is not power or strength. 

We have to do it together. We have to collectively commit to changing how the world sees domestic and care labor. We have to be intentional.

In Feminist theory, bell hooks says, â€œBefore women can work to reconstruct society, we must reject the notion that obtaining power in the existing social structure will necessarily advance feminist struggle to end sexist oppression.â€

It isnâ€™t just about placing more women in top-down places of power. Itâ€™s in rejecting the definition of power handed to us. Itâ€™s in rejecting the definition of US and our reality thatâ€™s been handed to us.

Power can be creative, connecting, nurturing, secure and deep. It can be collective, confident and tender. We must redefine our realities, place value intentionally and find power through community.

Also - F*CK these cards."

"This video is from 2021 and the facts remain: more funding, more training, and more resources to the police donâ€™t make our city safer.

label: general
post_content:
"We hosted an event last weekend and as a part of the discussion, we identified how we can center emotional labor in how we advocate for a more just world.

We talked about how it can be used to subjugate. Emotional labor is present when you ask for what you need. Itâ€™s present when you tend to someone elseâ€™s feelings. Itâ€™s present when you advocate.

Emotional labor can uphold gendered power imbalances. Many of us learn early on that there is safety in protecting men from shame. They may lash out at us or they may turn inward and shut down, withdrawing or spiraling out. We tiptoe, cater to and avoid conflict because weâ€™re taught that men who feel sad, hurt or angry can be dangerous. Not just physically, but in other punishing ways.

Emotional labor can also uphold racial power imbalances. A Black teenager at a store may notice a white woman clutch her purse. He may force a smile, make his body appear smaller or back away, mindful of his movements. He may feel hurt or frustrated, but maintaining her emotional comfort and making sure she doesnâ€™t feel threatened is important in keeping him safe.

Emotional labor can uphold ableist inequity. Being invited to a space and having access needs may require asking for accommodations. Having a need and knowing someone who has the ability to provide or deny means having to ask nicely and protect them from feeling guilty for not thinking of it. Wanting to be invited back means ensuring you arenâ€™t upsetting anyone while still hoping to get the support.

The threat of emotional backlash, or punishment fueled by feelings, can have a significant impact on our relationships and organizations. 

One thing we can do to create a more just world is take responsibility for our own emotional learning, our own emotional regulation and learn to communicate effectively. Being able to navigate conflict without blaming is important. Allowing yourself to feel hurt, challenged or ashamed without placing the burden of processing or protecting your feelings onto others.

So, sound offâ€¦ What else can we do?
(Pic: @jbg_photo )"

label: general
post_content:
"Generally, women who become mothers pay for itâ€¦ literally. On average, mothers experience about a 4% wage penalty per kid. 

- this penalty is higher among low wage workers
- this penalty disproportionately affects women of color
- the top 10% of wage earning women do not generally experience a wage penalty when they become mothers
- the top 5% of wage earning women on average benefit from a 1.7% wage increase for the first kid and a 5.4% increase for the second.

Iâ€™m so curiousâ€¦ what questions and conclusions come to mind when you hear this? 

*data is from â€œThe Fatherhood Bonus and The Motherhood Penalty: Parenthood and the Gender Gap in Payâ€ by Michelle J. Budig and I have the brilliant @elissaavery to thank for sharing it! She writes about the topic of care, culture and social change in her book When You Care."

label: general
post_content:
"This sound went viral late 2022. If youâ€™re not familiar, the Bluey song names the characters - â€œmumâ€, music, â€œdadâ€, music, then bingo and bluey. Folks used it by showing a clip or something moms did, then cut to what dad was doing at the same time. Variations of it were:

- Mom cooking dinner with kids hanging on her. Dad fumbling even without the kids around.

- Mom doing childcare while sick. Dad sick in bed.

- Mom packing and carrying all the bags to the car. Dad wandering, face in phone behind them.

And the most popular by far was this oneâ€¦ mom handling things while dad hid out in the bathroom.

This narrative is tired. It captures differing gendered expectations. It captures exaggerated beliefs about who does one does not/should and should not feel responsible for caregiving. It normalizes this dynamic. 

There are also nuggets of the tragedy of the nuclear family here. Working through illness. Struggling to manage unending demands from work and home. In a society that isolates us and discourages us from getting the support we need, the bathroom can be a momentary safe haven. Regardless of gender, many caregivers have experienced escaping to the bathroom for a break. 

The trick is not letting societyâ€™s overwhelming demands pit us against one another. Itâ€™s giving one another breaks in considerate ways, noticing the work weâ€™re all doing and showing up in ways that lighten the load rather than pushing it off without acknowledgement or consent.

We can do better! We deserve better!

#nomoremediocre #sitcomsyndrome"

"Survivors of gender-based violence are naming the harm caused by the criminal legal system. 

We are claiming our right to be made aware of alternative justice options. 

We are advocating for access to Restorative Justice after violence. 

Are you willing to hear us?

Restorative Justice prioritizes repair rather than punishment. Itâ€™s existed for centuries long before British colonization made the criminal legal system as we know it today the â€˜normâ€™. Restorative approaches focused on who was harmed and how we can heal while recognizing the humanity of all parties.

Survivors 4 justice reform is a global coalition of GBV survivors who stand for options beyond the carceral system, like restorative & transformative justice. We know there is no one size fits all when it comes to justice. These testimonies are a part of our Voices Campaign. Get involved & learn more by filling out the form in our bio âœï¸"

post_content:
"a message to my younger self 
1. you are not responsible for anyone elseâ€™s emotions beside your own. you are trying so hard to please people that you donâ€™t even like. save your time and energy and channel that into yourself. 
2. what other people think about you is none of your business.
3. there are people out there like you. youâ€™ll find them some day. 
4. there are resources out there to help you. find them soon. please. 
5. set boundaries for yourself in relationships. you need to put yourself first and respect yourself enough to not let certain behaviours continue. you deserve to be happy and you can and should cut people out who do not fit your view of happiness. 
6. no one is ever going to notice or care about your grades this year. or for the next few years even. heck, you end up dropping out of university anyway so as long as you pass, itâ€™ll be good enough for me. i wish you could be easier on yourself. youâ€™re worth so much more than grades. 
7. youâ€™re not good at sports because youâ€™re autistic. stop beating yourself up about it. 
8. you also are stressed all of the time because youâ€™re autistic. i know you feel you shouldnâ€™t be, but actually itâ€™s an appropriate response for you and your brain. youâ€™ll find ways to make things less stressful. (queue dropping out of university.) 
9. work on taking criticism better. itâ€™ll help a lot in the future. 
10. that gut creepy feeling you get around certain people- listen to it. trust yourself. you were always right about them. 
11. that boy youâ€™re in love with doesnâ€™t even cross your mind now. i promise he is not the end of the world. 
12. scrappy died 2 years ago, but you got through it. you have a macey now, and sheâ€™s yours. sheâ€™s amazing. you wouldâ€™ve loved her. kitty also is here and sheâ€™s obsessed with mom now ever since you went to camp, so she says hi but from afar.
13. donâ€™t paint your room orange
14. you are so special and important, and anyone who doesnâ€™t see that doesnâ€™t deserve you in their life
15. you will go through very hard times, but you always survive. i am so proud of you. i hope youâ€™re proud of me."

"pride month, and in case yâ€™all didnâ€™t know... ğŸ’—ğŸ’›ğŸ’™

i think my sexuality makes sense with my autistic brain. for a while i figured i must be bisexual, but that didnâ€™t fit that much... because for me, gender does not exist. i do not have a gender. sure, femininity, androgyny and masculinity exist (based off social constructs still, but at least this i can kinda understand). anyone can be feminine, anyone can be androgynous, anyone can be masculine, regardless of their gender identity. so how do i define my sexuality based off something so meaningless to me as gender? gender identity doesnâ€™t equal body parts, which i donâ€™t have a preference for. gender identity doesnâ€™t equal gender expression, which i actually do have a preference for. but no gender identity preference, because gender? what? 
i guess this is me kinda also talking about my gender, which iâ€™ve been confused about for a while, and i think i just, donâ€™t have one.. gender just doesnâ€™t feel right. gender doesnâ€™t exist to me. my gender expression is, whatever this is, and thatâ€™s how i like it right now. and thatâ€™s all:) 
so hello iâ€™m paige, and gender makes no sense to me, iâ€™m pansexual and use they/she pronouns ğŸ•ŠğŸ’•ğŸŒ¿ happy #pride ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ"

"this woman right here is my everything. 
my rock, my safe space. the one person in my life whose love is unconditional. who loves me when iâ€™m hard to love. who fights for me when i donâ€™t want to fight for myself. who thinks about me every second of the day and is the first to jump in whenever i need help, before i even know i need it. 
growing up i never thought we would have this relationship- it took some therapy, and some diagnoses later for us to understand each other, and she continues to learn more about how my brain works every day and what she can do to be the best for me. often times i feel i donâ€™t deserve her. i know iâ€™m difficult. i know i have struggles that neurotypicals like my brother donâ€™t have. and she fights for me every day, because she WANTS to. 
i donâ€™t know what i did to deserve this woman. i am so lucky, so grateful for you, mom. even though iâ€™m getting older now and leaving home, my real home will always be wherever you are. i love you."

post_content:
"I used to not enjoy St Patrickâ€™s day at all. Now itâ€™s okay, because I have green clothes now, and I have friends, and they have friends who are pretty cool and Iâ€™d like to call my friends, too. I felt like myself the whole night, even in a room of strangers. This led to a couple finding me and asking me more and more about their birth chart, and I got to excitedly infodump for an hour. Iâ€™m proud of myself. Of course, I had my loop earplugs to deal with the music and the people at my preferred level, and I brought so many clothes to change into so I could always become more comfortable as the night went on. I felt really happy. 
.
.
.
#actuallyautistic #autisticadult #autism #paigelayle #audhd #adhd #autismsocial"

"â€¼ï¸TW suic1de statistics in autistic people. 

Itâ€™s not the diagnosis itself but the proper, specific support that is the most likely to be affective in helping someone who is actively suic1dal and undiagnosed autistic. 

Practises designed for the allistic brain are completely ineffective for me and oftentimes can make the frustration and isolation worse. 

The fact that thereâ€™s even a two digit percentage of suic1des that are autistic people when we make up less than 2% of the population is wild. 

Iâ€™m not going to copy and paste links from where this info is from because this isnâ€™t an english paper and you can look it up quickly and find all the sources. /genuine 

Free Gaza.

label: general
post_content:
""We may act as though we're the same as you. We smile, but we dissociate when we touch a texture we don't like, or when the lights are too bright, or when we can hear every watt of electricity surging through the kitchen at night. We pretend we don't actually notice. We pretend it doesn't bother us. We try to have meltdowns and shutdowns in private to avoid being punished and ridiculed for disruptive behaviour. We go through life struggling to stay afloat while it looks like everyone around us is doing just fine.

I had to hide to be safe.

We don't deserve to have to hide our whole lives and struggle in silence. We deserve inclusion, acceptance, equity, and appreciation; actually, we need it. We need it to survive. For many years, I struggled because I didn't know that I was autistic. The diagnosis gave me an answer." 

Quote from "But Everyone Feels This Way" written by me â¤ï¸â€ğŸ©¹

To get your own copy of my story: https://www.hachettebookgroup.com/titles/paige-layle/but-everyone-feels-this-way/9780306831256/

#PaigleLayle #ButEveryoneFeelsThisWay #AutisticAuthor #ActuallyAutistic"

label: general
post_content:
"TW: Eating Disorders/ARFID (Avoidant Restrictive Food Intake Disorder)

I've struggled with disordered eating since I could say, "my belly wants it but my mouth doesnâ€™t." I remember eating kielbasa in class until suddenly, I focused on it and threw up. Things got worse in 2019 when I went vegan after watching documentaries. Meat and dairy disgusted me, but it made my ARFID worse, causing me to lose a ton of weight too quickly.  When people talk negatively about a food, I often think, "AHH STFU BEFORE MY BRAIN BELIEVES YOU!" I can't risk losing another safe food. 

Ice cream and pasta have been my lifesavers, helping me maintain my weight. I usually order pasta from restaurants because cooking it myself is too much. Recently, my favourite seafood pasta from One-Eyed Jacks hasn't been hitting the same, likely because they changed the cheese, and it's making me consider giving up on it. ğŸ˜©

At the end of the day, I know 'fed is best' and that I am trying the best I can. 

Love, 
Paige xo ğŸ©·ğŸ"

post_content:
"about 2 months ago, i had the opportunity to go to LA to film a youtube video for jubilee, guessing who is autistic. 

this was going to be the first time I travelled fully alone, without someone there to pick me up at the airport and drive me around and help me. i left my home at 10:30am and i was home within 48 hours. i also touched down in detroit and philadelphia, so it was a heck of a lot of new. 

but i knew i wanted to do it so badly once i was asked.

here are some pics of my journey: 
i couldnâ€™t tell you what im saying in the second video. just a lot of echolalia and vocal stimming and hyperverbal stress talk. 
it was a huge heatwave so it was the freaking hottest the entire time! 
i woke up in my hotel room and BOOM, mountains ??? california really gives 

ill be posting more about this trip and my methodology for determining if random strangers are autistic on my patreon. 
go check out the video if you havenâ€™t seen it already. search â€œjubileeâ€ on youtube and click on my face. (as of time of posting).

thanks everyone. and please be nice to me and everyone. 

@jubileemedia #autisticadult #paigelayle"

label: general
post_content:
"continuing on the topic of lessons I learned through my years in the gym..

ğŸ§˜ğŸ»â€â™€ï¸ TOOK MY REST DAYS MORE SERIOUSLY and understood the importance and value of them. that rest is also growth and they are crucial in the process of building muscles. I used to train 6-7 days /week. today I train 3-4 times /week

ğŸ¥˜ FOOD ALIGNED WITH MY GOALS AND ACTIVITIES to make sure to not undereat. I used to eat way less calories than what my body needed and this really prevented me from reaching my goals

ğŸ‘€ CONSTANTLY CHASING NEW EXERCISES was a trend back in the days and we lost our way. instead of trying to invent the wheel again, stick to a plan!!! the longer the better. be the absolute best you can be on a few exercises, track, overview and progress!

ğŸ‹ğŸ¼â€â™€ï¸ LESS EXERCISES / SESSION (as mentioned 2 days ago) I used to do over 7+ exercises in one session back in the days. By the time I got to the end of the session I was so fatigued and had no energy to complete the workouts and had to force myself into doing the rest. today I do 4-5 exercises per session which allows me to put 100% quality and focus into those exercises.

âœ–ï¸DOING 12/15+ REPS FOR EVERY SET AND EXERCISE
when I started to switch reps from 12-15 reps in all exercises and all sets, to 5-7, 6-8, 8-10 thatâ€™s when things started to happen. think of it like this, if you can do 12 reps x 3 sets of the same weights, youâ€™re not pushing yourself enough! we need progressive overload and mind muscle connection. we want quality. today I do all from  5-7 reps for my heaviest sets where I train to failure/close to failure which is crucial part for muscle growth. to 8-10 reps and 12-15 reps as my back-off sets

Hope this helps ğŸ«¶ğŸ¼ 
loads of love xx"

post_content:
"we need to talk..

ever since Collin was born, the questions has been many.. â€œwhen are you having one moreâ€, â€œwhen is your second baby comingâ€, â€œwhen is Collin getting a siblingâ€, and statements like â€œCollin needs a siblingâ€..

listen.. I KNOW you mean well ğŸ«¶ğŸ¼ I KNOW itâ€™s asked out of love, and I know I share my life openly on socials.. but, I want to kindly create awareness around this, as this is a super personal and vulnerable question to ask someone. we need to understand the importance of the different scenarios playing a part here. the fact that some couples might be struggling to even get pregnant and this can be really hard to deal with. some couples need to go through IVF. some couples might been through a miscarriage, god forbid. some couples might not be able to even carry a baby. and some couples donâ€™t want more kids.

Imo I donâ€™t think we should ask ppl this question in general, rather than friends. Iâ€™m just saying, please be careful who you are asking, if you donâ€™t know the full story.

weâ€™d LOVE to have another baby, and when the time is right, we pray that weâ€™re blessed with a sibling for Collin ğŸ–¤"

post_content:
"I turn 40 today! I've been ambivalent about this milestone, as probably all women are. After all, we're perennially pruned by a misogynistic culture which insists that, of the many things that subtract value from a woman (and there are so many!), the addition of age is surely the most egregious.

Women cannot help ageing, but are blamed for it anyway.Â 

And meanwhile there are people who do not have the privilege of ageing at all.

So maybe it's important to reflect on what's going right.

In the last year, some cool things have happened:

âœğŸ» Signed with literary agent @zeitgeistwriters

ğŸ“• Hosted the Brisbane launch of @clementine_ford amazing book 'I Don't: the case against marriage'

ğŸ™ï¸ Got to be a guest on @yvie_jones excellent podcast

ğŸ—½ Fulfilled a long-time dream of visiting New York City - and played drag bingo at the Stonewall Inn!

ğŸ“ˆ Had a few pieces of sarcastic feminist content go viral

ğŸ“º Branched out into YouTube

ğŸ‰ Got to ring in some 40th & 50th birthdays of excellent people, a wedding, and my parents' 50th anniversary

ğŸ©° Took my mum & sister to their first ever ballets

ğŸŒˆ Went to many queer community events

ğŸ‰ Went to rallies and fundraisers for what's right

Bonus: got to do most of it with my beloved @beehyphendub

But getting old brings with it a lot of creaks and groans in the old ship's hull, so lest you think my life is too good, here's what it also feels like to be rounding 40:

ğŸ‘©â€âš•ï¸ Had a breast cancer scare and truly the most unpleasant and traumatic medical experience of my life (results: negative)

ğŸ¥¦ Had a bowel cancer scare (also negative)

ğŸ©¸ Discovered and fixed a brutal iron deficiency

â¤ï¸ Learned that I have a dodgy heart and vascular systemÂ 

But as dodgy as my heart is, it will never be as ugly or defective as the hearts of men who call me (and women like me) old, washed-up and irrelevant simply for having grown wiser than they could ever hope to be.

Whatever side of 40 you are on, I wish you the joy of a diving duck, and the deflective oil on its back.Â 

Cheers ğŸ¥‚"
